title: How to Cook Zipper Bag Omelets

steps.headline: Cut, Chop, Shred ...
steps.description: Prepare the fillings you want in your omelet.

steps.headline: Boil water in a large pot.
You need a one-quart freezer bag for each omelet you are cooking.
Break two eggs into a bowl.
steps.description: Beat eggs with a whisk or fork—like you would for scrambled eggs—then pour them into the freezer bag.

steps.headline: Place the omelet filling into the freezer bag.
Close the bag and mix all of the ingredients and eggs together by gently shaking the bag.
Open the bag to remove air, then reseal.
Place the bag into the boiling water for about 12 minutes.
Remove bag form water.
steps.description: Open bag, dump eggs onto a plate and serve.

text: Cut, Chop, Shred ... Prepare the fillings you want in your omelet. Boil water in a large pot.  You need a one-quart freezer bag for each omelet you are cooking.  Break two eggs into a bowl. Beat eggs with a whisk or fork—like you would for scrambled eggs—then pour them into the freezer bag. Place the omelet filling into the freezer bag.  Close the bag and mix all of the ingredients and eggs together by gently shaking the bag.  Open the bag to remove air, then reseal.  Place the bag into the boiling water for about 12 minutes.  Remove bag form water. Open bag, dump eggs onto a plate and serve.
